newsitem.title: NORWAY: Statoil firms up Norway maintenance plan.
newsitem.headline: Statoil firms up Norway maintenance plan.

text.p: Den norske stats oljeselskap AS (Statoil) on Thursday confirmed maintenance plans for its fields on the Norwegian continental shelf.
Statoil said shutdowns at Statfjord would be confined to the B platform, which will begin an 18-day turnaround from August 9.
Work in the Sleipner area will start on August 8 and is due to last for 12 days on the A platform and until August 26 for Sleipner T, part of the Sleipner West development.
Gullfaks A will be shut down from August 25 to September 19, with the B platform going into turnaround from August 24 to September 20.
No maintenance is planned for Gullfaks C.
Statoil said Troll A has a 12-day shutdown between August 4-16 during which the land-based Troll gas facility at Kollsnes near Bergen will suspend operations.
No turnarounds are planned on the North Sea Yme field, the Heidrun platform off mid-Norway or at the Kaarstoe gas treatment plant north of Stavanger.
Maintenance work is also planned for the Mongstad refinery near Bergen in August and October, Statoil said.
